definition: to hit on someone/to strike up a conversation/to start talking to end an awkward silence or embarrassing situation
to put up/to build (scaffolding)/to hang (clothes on a pole)/to connect/to join/to arrange in pairs/to match/to add/to throw in (resources)/to take (boat, train)/variant of 褡[da1]

sentences.english: A stranger accosted him on the bus.
sentences.chinese: 一位陌生人在公共汽车上同他搭讪。

sentences.english: Mr White likes chatting up the girls.
sentences.chinese: 怀特先生喜欢跟姑娘们搭讪。

sentences.english: They also accused Heathfield of chatting up someone who worked at a U.S. nuclear facility.
sentences.chinese: 他们还指控希思菲尔德与美国核设施的工作人员搭讪。

sentences.english: A friendly man came and talked to him.
sentences.chinese: 一个看似面善的男人走向他跟他搭讪。

sentences.english: Don't have a chat with unknown men, and don't answer any accosts .
sentences.chinese: 不要和陌生男人聊天和接受他们的搭讪。

sentences.english: She detests having to talk to people at parties.
sentences.chinese: 在宴会上她不喜欢同别人搭讪。

sentences.english: You will always win using pick-up lines that are humorous and tasteful.
sentences.chinese: 用这样幽默和高雅的搭讪语你总能成功的。

sentences.english: Diarmuid : Some people use chat-up lines to start a conversation with someone they like.
sentences.chinese: 有些人用搭讪的话与他们同类的人开始对话。

sentences.english: Feeling embarrassed, he muttered a few words and walked off.
sentences.chinese: 他很尴尬，搭讪着走开了。

sentences.english: It is forbidden to accost others while chewing.
sentences.chinese: 决不可嚼着东西跟别人搭讪。

sentences.english: Forget witty chat-up lines and splashing on the aftershave .
sentences.chinese: 忘了那些风趣的搭讪和须后水吧。

sentences.english: If I were good at French, I would go and flirt with him.
sentences.chinese: 要是我会说法语的话，我就会去找他搭讪了。

sentences.english: No one likes to hear the same joke twice and the same goes for pick-up lines.
sentences.chinese: 没有人喜欢听同一个笑话两次，搭讪语也是一样。

sentences.english: Long story short, she was hitting on me all night and acting like a complete skank.
sentences.chinese: 长话短说，她整晚都在和我搭讪，这让人感觉恶心。

sentences.english: Most pick-up lines are just stale closed-ended statements.
sentences.chinese: 大多数的搭讪语都是老掉牙的封闭的陈述。

sentences.english: A meeting had immediately taken place between the Countess and Mr. Rosier .
sentences.chinese: 伯爵夫人和罗齐尔先生已经搭讪上了。

definition: to talk/to get into conversation with/to send word
to ask for directions/to ask the way (to some place)
to gang up/to fool around with/to make up to
to worm one's way into being friends with sb (usually derogatory)
(slang) to hook up for a one night stand/booty call
to take liberties with a woman/to dally/to assail a woman with obscenities
to ask sb out (on a date etc)
partner for dating/a date (boyfriend or girlfriend)
to pick up girls/to play around with girls/to chase after girls
to take advantage of sb/to freeload
to throw oneself in sb's arms/to throw oneself at sb
